doc.field: Printing Blocks for What is Mathematics

Richard Courant (1988-1972) was a mathematician and one of the founders of the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences at New York University. In 1941, Courant and Hebert Robbins published What is Mathematics?, an introductory book for students and the wider public. The content of the book was largely based on Courant's course materials. This collection consists of 10 printing blocks from the book What is Mathematics: An Elementary Approach to Ideas and Methods, as well as one copy of the book.

Richard Courant (1988-1972) was a mathematician and one of the founders of the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences at New York University. In 1941, Courant and Hebert Robbins published What is Mathematics?, an introductory book for students and the wider public. The content of the book was largely based on Courant's course materials. This collection consists of 10 printing blocks from the book What is Mathematics: An Elementary Approach to Ideas and Methods, as well as one copy of the book.
This collection consists of 10 printing blocks from the book What is Mathematics: An Elementary Approach to Ideas and Methods by Richard Courant, as well as one copy of the book.

Richard Courant (1988-1972) was a mathematician and one of the founders of the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences at New York University. In 1941, Courant and Hebert Robbins published What is Mathematics?, an introductory book for students and the wider public. The content of the book was largely based on Courant's course materials.

This collection was transferred from the Courant Institute Library in July 2023 along with other collections in the library's holdings. Original provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this transfer is 2023.049.

Archivists selected for inclusion in this collection a representative sample of blocks ranging in size and subject matter. Printing blocks that exhibited signs of deterioration were not selected for inclusion in this collection.
